greeting: Greetings from The On-Line Encyclopedia of Integer Sequences! http://oeis.org/

results.name: Square array A(n,m), n>=0, m>=0, read by antidiagonals, where column m is the expansion of g.f. 1/ (1-x^1*(1-x^(m+1))/ (1-x^2*(1-x^(m+2))/ (1- ... ))).
link: Alois P. Heinz, Antidiagonals n = 0..140, flattened
Paul D. Hanna et al., Formula Needed for a Family of Continued Fractions and follow-up messages on the SeqFan list, Jul 28 2013
mathematica: nMax = 12; col[m_ /; 0 <= m <= nMax] := 1/(1 + ContinuedFractionK[-x^k (1 - x^(m + k)), 1, {k, 1, Ceiling[nMax/2]}]) + O[x]^(2 nMax) // CoefficientList[#, x]&; A = Table[col[m][[1 ;; nMax + 1]], {m, 0, nMax}] // Transpose; a[n_ /; 0 <= n <= nMax, m_ /; 0 <= m <= nMax] := With[{n1 = n + 1, m1 = m + 1}, A[[n1, m1]]]; Table[a[n - m, m], {n, 0, nMax}, {m, n, 0, -1}] // Flatten (* _Jean-François Alcover_, Nov 03 2016 *)
results.author: _Alois P. Heinz_, Aug 29 2013
